metadata.dcterms:title: Vitamin D and K Status Influences Bone Mineral Density and Bone Accrual in Children and Adolescents with Celiac Disease
metadata.dcterms:creator: Mager, Diana
Turner, Justine
Qiao, Jing
metadata.dcterms:description: The study objective was to determine the interrelationships between vitamin K/D status and lifestyle variables on bone mineral density) in children and adolescents with celiac disease at diagnosis and after 1 year on the gluten-free diet.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
nutrition
pediatrics
gluten-free diet
vitamin d
vitamin k
bone mineral density
cohort studies
celiac disease
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Mager, DR, Qiao J, Turner J. Vitamin D and K status influences bone mineral density and bone accrual in children and adolescents with celiac disease. European Journal of Clinical Nutrition (2012) 66, 488-495., doi, 10.1038/ejcn.2011.176, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21970944
metadata.dcterms:type: BMD data; Anthropometric data, dietary and physical activity; Biosamples
